page.title: 15MYTTON & FITZ-FARMING
page.content: {MYTTON & FITZ }_ FARMING Mytton & Fitz are both farming communities.Mytton Farm owns 250 acres,most of which is used forgrowing hay,for the farmer to sell part of to a nearby dairy cattle farmer.The remainder is used to feed his 700 _ 800 sheep.He also,grows fodder beat.However,this has to be rotated every 4 years and harvested in Nov./Dec. Each field is about 20 acres. Sheep have devastated a lot of the hadges.Small fields are difficult to work on with modern farm machinery and the 6"pipe drainage system has been replaced with 9"pipes.Before this,the land was boggy and hard to manage in June.4.9"of rainfall fell in this area.
